newsitem.title: FRANCE: French CIC sale terms near ready - paper.
newsitem.headline: French CIC sale terms near ready - paper.

text.p: France's finance ministry is about to finalise conditions for privatisation of Credit Industriel et Commercial (CIC) bank and they will be more flexible than those imposed in a first sale tender last year which the government ended up halting, the daily La Tribune said on Friday.

The newspaper, citing "a source close to the case" said the terms and conditions for the sale of the regional banking group, which is owned by state insurer GAN, were less rigid and could leave room for a buyer to subsequently sell off parts.

It also said CIC had struck a deal with its parent which would hike the fees it gets for distributing GAN life assurance products through its branches under their Socapi joint venture and that CIC would own the vneture to the tune of 55 percent.
The newspaper said it believed that, in addition to Credit Commercial de France eyeing the bank, Belgium's Generale de Banque could also be interested in CIC.
